title.value: Identifying Spurious Biases Early in Training through the Lens of Simplicity Bias
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: Identifying Spurious Biases Early in Training through the Lens of Simplicity Bias

extractions.description: This paper provides a theoretical analysis of the effect of simplicity bias on learning spurious correlations during neural network training. The authors show that examples with spurious features are separable based on model output early in training and propose a method named Spare to address these biases.

type.justification: The paper is focused on providing a theoretical analysis of simplicity bias and its effects on neural network training.
type.quote: In this work, we provide the first theoretical analysis of the effect of simplicity bias on learning spurious correlations.

name.justification: The research focuses on understanding and improving neural network training, which is a core part of Machine Learning.
name.quote: Neural networks trained with (stochastic) gradient descent have an inductive bias towards learning simpler solutions.

name.justification: The paper focuses on training dynamics, specifically examining the early phases of neural network training and how simplicity bias impacts the learning of spurious correlations.
name.quote: First, we prove that the simplicity bias of gradient descent can be leveraged to identify spurious correlations.

name.justification: The paper proposes a method to mitigate bias in neural network training, particularly focusing on spurious correlations.
name.quote: We propose Spare, which identifies spurious correlations early in training, and utilizes importance sampling to alleviate their effect.

name.justification: Spare is the primary model proposed by the paper to identify and mitigate spurious correlations early in neural network training.
name.quote: Finally, we propose an efficient and lightweight method, Spare (SePArate early and REsample), that clusters model’s output early in training, and leverage importance sampling based on inverse cluster sizes to mitigate spurious correlations.

is_contributed.justification: Spare is a new method introduced by the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Finally, we propose an efficient and lightweight method, Spare (SePArate early and REsample), that clusters model’s output early in training, and leverage importance sampling based on inverse cluster sizes to mitigate spurious correlations.

is_executed.justification: Experiments with Spare are conducted using neural networks, which are typically trained on GPUs.
is_executed.quote: Fig. 2 shows that the prediction of the network on the majority group is almost exclusively indicated by the color of the majority group, confirming Theorem 4.3. The bottom of Fig. 2 shows that the majority and minority groups are separable based on the network output, confirming Corollary 4.2.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares Spare to other state-of-the-art bias mitigation methods.
is_compared.quote: Our extensive experiments confirm that Spare achieves up to 42.9% higher worst-group accuracy over state-of-the-art on most commonly used benchmarks.
